ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Noise-Induced Hearing Loss (Acoustic Trauma)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Bilateral high-frequency SNHL with a distinct 4000 Hz notch, deeper in the left ear (consistent with right-handed rifle shooting). History of recreational noise exposure.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Otosclerosis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Family history suggests otosclerosis, but patient's audiometric pattern (notch, high-frequency loss) and normal tympanograms make this unlikely/unrelated.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Assess speech reception and recognition abilities.
Assess reflex pathways and check for recruitment.
Rule out retrocochlear pathology given asymmetry.
Assess cochlear outer hair cell function.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Audiometry reveals bilateral high-frequency sensorineural hearing loss with a prominent acoustic trauma notch at 4000 Hz, significantly worse in the left ear. This asymmetry is consistent with the acoustic shadow effect from shooting a rifle right-handed. Middle ear function is normal. Retrocochlear pathology is ruled out by negative tone decay, absent TEOAEs (consistent with cochlear loss), and ABR results showing a cochlear pattern (steep latency-intensity function). Speech recognition is excellent.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral high-frequency SNHL with 4000 Hz notch. Right 4000 Hz ~35 dB HL, Left 4000 Hz ~60 dB HL. Normal hearing 250-2000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT Right 15 dB HL, Left 25 dB HL. SRS 100% bilaterally.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal Type A bilaterally. Static compliance Right 0.52 cc, Left 0.70 cc.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Present but elevated (85-95 dB HL), consistent with cochlear recruitment.

tests.name: ABR
tests.result_summary: All waves prolonged; interpeak latencies normal; latency-intensity function steep. Suggests cochlear pathology.

tests.name: Tone decay test
tests.result_summary: Negative (5 dB decay in 60 seconds at 4000 Hz).

proposed_items: Use hearing protection (special impact-noise plugs or foam plugs) for hunting/shooting.
Use loudspeakers instead of earphones for music.
Lower volume when listening to music.
Re-evaluation of hearing in six months.
Test interoctave frequencies (3000 and 6000 Hz) at next visit.
counseling_actions: Explain the nature of the loss (noise-induced) and the specific 4000 Hz notch.
Explain the asymmetry as likely due to the 'acoustic shadow' from shooting right-handed.
Stress the importance of preventing progression by avoiding noise.
Clarify that family history (otosclerosis) is likely unrelated to current findings.

escalation.rationale_short: Routine monitoring for progression of noise-induced hearing loss.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor for progression of hearing loss.
